#summary This page shows different versions of the "Login Example" application

= Login Example =

<wiki:toc max_depth="3" />

Please read the [LoginExampleFeatureSpec Feature Specification] of the Login Example application. The following code examples provide solutions for several dimensions in Flex development:

 # *Flex SDKs* (Flex 3.5 "Halo", Flex 4.1 "Gumbo" and Flex 4.5 "Hero")
 # *Runtimes* (Adobe Flashplayer & Adobe AIR)
 # *Mobile platforms* (Google Android, Apple iOS TODO and !BlackBerry Tablet OS TODO)
 # *Flex 3 to Flex 4 Migration Guide*
 # *MVC Microarchitectures* ([http://sourceforge.net/adobe/cairngorm Cairngorm 2.2.2],  [http://trac.puremvc.org/PureMVC_AS3/ PureMVC 2.0.4] TODO)
 # *IoC Microarchitectures* ([http://mate.asfusion.com/ Mate 0.9.1], [http://www.robotlegs.org/ Robotlegs 1.5.2], [http://www.spicefactory.org/parsley/ Parsley 2.4.1], [http://www.springactionscript.org/ Spring AS 1.1], [http://www.swizframework.org/ Swiz 1.3.1])
 # *Eventarchitectures* ([https://github.com/robertpenner/as3-signals/wiki AS3-Signals])
 # *Nanoarchitectures* ([NanoarchitectureMVCb MVCb], [NanoarchitectureCpll Cpll], [NanoarchitectureCpsh Cpsh], Ctl, Cmd, [NanoarchitectureNoEvt NoEvt], [NanoarchitecturePInj PInj])
 # *Design Pattern* (Presentation Model, Code Behind, Presenter, Mediator, MVP TODO ... etc.)
 # *[http://sourceforge.net/adobe/cairngorm/wiki/CairngormLibraries/ Cairngorm 3 Libraries]* ([http://sourceforge.net/adobe/cairngorm/wiki/CairngormLibraries/#Validation Validation Library], [http://sourceforge.net/adobe/cairngorm/wiki/CairngormLibraries/#Task Task Library], [http://sourceforge.net/adobe/cairngorm/wiki/CairngormLibraries/#Observer Observer Library])
 # *Continuous Integration* ([http://maven.apache.org/ Apache Maven], [http://flexmojos.sonatype.org/ Flexmojos] TODO)
 # *Build and Deployment Tools* ([http://ant.apache.org/ Apache Ant] with !FlexTasks library)
 # *Testing frameworks* ([http://flexunit.org/ FlexUnit 4.0])
 # *Flex Automation* ([http://www.riatest.com/ RIATest], [http://www.gorillalogic.com/flexmonkey FlexMonkey] ... etc.)
 # *Server projects* ([http://www.silexlabs.org/amfphp/ AmfPHP 1.9], [http://framework.zend.com/download/amf Zend AMF 1.11.11], BlazeDS TODO, GraniteDS TODO)
 # *Flex coding conventions* ([Flex3CodingConventions Flex 3], [Flex4CodingConventions Flex 4])
 # *Project planning* (see [LoginExampleFeatureSpec Login Example Feature Specification])

== Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) ==

==== Why have you created the Login Example? ==== 
Please read my [LetterOfMotivation Letter of Motivation].

==== What's a Nanoarchitecture? ==== 
Please read this page about [Nanoarchitecture Nanoarchitectures].

==== Which Microarchitecture has the best performance? ==== 
Don't know. Maybe somebody could create performance tests for it ;)

==== Which Microarchitecture do you prefer? ==== 
I am not making that decision for you. It is up to you to decide which one suites best to your needs.

==== Why haven't you choosen Microarchitectures like PureMVC, !SmartyPants or Flicc ... etc. for your Login Example? ==== 
I am thinking of adding other Microarchitectures, too. If they fit into the concept I will definitely add them. One issue I have with PureMVC and Robotlegs (without AS3-Signals) is that they are using the Mediator pattern for their views. This feels quiet massive when you want to work with !SkinnableComponents in Flex 4 (3 classes = Skin class + !SkinnableComponent + Mediator). If you have a good solution please [http://www.masuland.com?content=contact let me know]. Thanks!

==== Why do you have only so few Robotlegs and Mate examples for the Login Example? Are you biased? ==== 
No! I just have started adding Robotlegs and Mate examples to the Login Example.

==== Which Nanoarchitectures do you prefer? ==== 
For Flex 4 applications, I recommend, you should have a look at the [LoginExample#Flex_4.1_(Spark)_with_MVCpshStoTsk_PInjNoEvt Login Example for Flex 4.1 (Spark) with MVCpshStoTsk_PInjNoEvt] Nanoarchitectures. For Flex 3 applications, consider to use the [NanoarchitectureMVCb "Model - View - Code Behind" (MVCb)] Nanoarchitecture as shown in the [LoginExample#Flex_4.1_(MX)_with_MVCbCtl LoginExample for Flex 4.1 (MX) with MVCbCtl].

==== How can I migrate my Flex 3 application to a Flex 4 application? ====
Please read this [MigrationFromFlex3ToFlex4 Flex 3 to Flex 4 Migration Guide].

==== I have found issues in your code examples. Where can I post them? ====
You can post problems and feature enhancements into my [http://code.google.com/p/masuland/issues/list issue tracker], or, you can contact me [http://www.masuland.com?content=contact directly].

==== Can I participate in your project? ====
Sure! There are still things left for me to do (see [http://code.google.com/p/masuland/issues/list issue tracker]). Any help would be appreciated!

==== Who is this guy occupying land in the web? ====
Details about me can be found [http://masuland.wordpress.com/about/ here].
